Question
========
Suppose `x <- c("a", "b", "c")`. What does `x[c(TRUE, FALSE, TRUE)]` return?

Answerlist
----------
* "a" "c"
* "b"
* "a" "b" "c"
* TRUE FALSE TRUE

Solution
========
Logical indexing keeps elements where the logical vector is TRUE. Here, it keeps elements 1 and 3, returning `c("a", "c")`.
